name: BlogCardOne
description: Blog section with card grid/carousel layout featuring image, category, title, excerpt, and author info.

description.example: Insights and updates from our team

blogs.example: [{"id": "1", "category": "Design", "title": "UX review presentations", "excerpt": "How to create compelling presentations", "imageSrc": "/blog-1.jpg", "authorName": "John Doe", "authorAvatar": "/avatar-1.jpg", "date": "20 Jan 2025"}]
blogs.note: Array of blog items. Each item requires id, category, title, excerpt, imageSrc, authorName, authorAvatar, and date.

propsSchema.blogs: Array<{ id: string, category: string, title: string, excerpt: string, imageSrc: string, imageAlt?: string, authorName: string, authorAvatar: string, date: string, onBlogClick?: () => void }> - Blog card items
propsSchema.animationType: 'none' | 'opacity' | 'slide-up' | 'scale-rotate' | 'blur-reveal' (required - controls GSAP scroll animations with stagger effect)
propsSchema.title: string
propsSchema.titleSegments?: Array<{ type: 'text', content: string } | { type: 'image', src: string, alt?: string }> - For inline images in title
propsSchema.buttons?: Array<{text: string, onClick?: () => void, href?: string}>
propsSchema.textboxLayout: 'default' | 'split' | 'split-actions' | 'split-description' | 'inline-image' (required - 'inline-image' uses titleSegments for rich text with images)

usageExample: <BlogCardOne blogs={[{id: '1', category: 'Design', title: 'UX review presentations', excerpt: 'How to create compelling presentations that wow your audience', imageSrc: '/blog-1.jpg', authorName: 'Olivia Rhye', authorAvatar: '/avatar-1.jpg', date: '20 Jan 2025', onBlogClick: () => console.log('clicked')}]} title="Latest Articles" description="Stay updated with our latest insights" textboxLayout="default" useInvertedBackground={"noInvert"} animationType="slide-up" carouselMode="buttons" />
